item.title: Comforting Chicken and Gravy in the Crockpot
item.description: Hearty chicken and gravy cooked in the crockpot makes dinner a breeze! Juicy chicken simmered in savory gravy, served with mashed potatoes or rice. Try this for your next family dinner!
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 240 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
  • 1 can (10.5 oz) cream of chicken soup
  • 1 packet (1 oz) ranch dressing mix
  • 1 cup chicken broth
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Chopped parsley for garnish

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. First up, drizzle some olive oil in your crockpot. Just a tablespoon, no need to go crazy.
  2. Next, season your chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Yeah, you wanna make sure theyâ€™re flavorful.
  3. Add the chicken to the crockpot, then dump in the cream of chicken soup and the ranch dressing mix. Smells good already, right?
  4. Pour in the chicken broth over everything. Itâ€™s like, seriously, this is gonna be so easy.
  5. Cover and cook on low for about 4 hours. Youâ€™ll know itâ€™s done when the chicken is tender and shreddable.
  6. Shred the chicken right in the pot, mix it all together, and serve it up over mashed potatoes or rice. So good!

item.title: Creamy Brown Butter Mashed Potatoes Recipe
item.description: You gotta try these creamy brown butter mashed potatoes! Infused with rich, nutty flavors, they add a twist to your usual recipe. Ideal for family gatherings or cozy dinners. Save this recipe for your next meal!
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 20 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 4

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 pounds russet potatoes, peeled and quartered
  • 1/2 cup unsalted Kerrygold butter
  • 1/2 cup whole milk, warmed
  • Salt, to taste
  • Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
  • Optional: chopped fresh chives for garnish

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Start by boiling a large pot of salted water. Add the quartered potatoes and cook them for about 15 minutes until super tender. You wanna make sure theyâ€™re soft enough to mash easily.
  2. While the potatoes are cooking, melt the Kerrygold butter in a skillet over medium heat. Keep an eye on it and stir occasionally until it turns golden brown and smells nutty. Seriously, this step is where the magic happens.
  3. Once the potatoes are done, drain them and return them to the pot. Mash them up until smooth. You can use a potato masher or even a ricer (my personal favorite).
  4. Pour the browned butter into the mashed potatoes, along with the warmed milk. Mix everything together until creamy and well combined. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  5. If youâ€™re feeling fancy, sprinkle some chopped chives on top before serving. They add a nice pop of color and flavor!

item.title: Hearty Beef Stew That'll Warm Your Heart
item.description: Warm up with this hearty beef stew that'll fill your home with incredible aromas! Full of tender beef, colorful veggies, and aromatic herbs, this dish is a go-to for cozy nights. Great for family dinners or gatherings. Don't forget to pin this for later!
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 120 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Medium

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 pounds beef chuck, cut into bite-sized pieces
  • 4 cups beef broth (homemade or store-bought)
  • 3 large carrots, sliced
  • 3 potatoes, diced
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 3 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 tablespoons tomato paste
  • 1 teaspoon dried thyme
  • 1 teaspoon dried rosemary
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 cup frozen peas
  • 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the beef chunks and brown them on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Seriously, don't overcrowd the pot or they won't brown right.
  2. Remove the beef and set it aside. In the same pot, add the chopped onion and garlic, cooking until they're fragrant and the onion is translucent, about 3-4 minutes.
  3. Stir in the tomato paste, thyme, and rosemary. Let that simmer for a minute, then return the beef to the pot.
  4. Pour in the beef broth and add the carrots and potatoes. Bring everything to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and let it simmer for about 1.5 hours. You'll know it's ready when the beef is super tender.
  5. In the last 15 minutes, add the frozen peas and Worcestershire sauce. If it seems thick, add a little more broth or water.
  6. Serve hot in bowls, maybe with some crusty bread on the side. Your kitchen will smell amazing!

item.title: Comforting Meatloaf and Creamy Mashed Potatoes in No Time
item.description: A hearty meatloaf with creamy mashed potatoes ready in just 45 minutes! Made with simple ingredients like ground beef, breadcrumbs, and a hint of ketchup for flavor. Great for family dinners or a cozy weeknight meal. Save this recipe for later!
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 30 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 4

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 lb ground beef
  • 1 cup breadcrumbs (I use Bob's Red Mill)
  • 1/2 cup onion, finely chopped
  • 1/2 cup ketchup (save some for topping)
  • 1 egg, beaten
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1/2 tsp black pepper
  • 2 lbs potatoes, peeled and quartered
  • 1/2 cup milk (I like Organic Valley)
  • 4 tbsp butter (Kerrygold is my go-to)
  • Salt and pepper to taste

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). Trust me, itâ€™s key for even cooking.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, breadcrumbs, chopped onion, ketchup, egg, garlic powder, salt, and pepper until combined. No need to overmix - just enough to bring it all together.
  3. Shape the mixture into a loaf and place it in a baking dish. Spread a little extra ketchup on top for that classic touch.
  4. Bake for about 30 minutes, or until the internal temperature hits 160Â°F. Honestly, itâ€™ll smell amazing while cooking!
  5. Meanwhile, place the quartered potatoes in a pot of cold salted water. Bring to a boil and cook until tender, about 15-20 minutes. Youâ€™ll know theyâ€™re done when you can easily pierce them with a fork.
  6. Drain the potatoes and return them to the pot. Add in the milk and butter, then mash until creamy. Season with salt and pepper to your liking. Serve alongside the meatloaf.
